intro: Quercus dumosa var. kinseliae, commonly known as the Kinsel’s scrub oak, is a shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dense, gnarled growth habit and small, leathery leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, acorn-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and chaparral habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native range.
